titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: James B. Hosmer (1911-2001) was a flutist and composer of "Rhapsody for flute and string quartet." Hosmer studied with Georges Barrere and played with the Indianapolis Symphony from 1937 to 1942.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of scores for flute. The materials include: printed and manuscript scores; fingering charts; manuscript notes and corrections; a small number of programs and clippings of reviews; and a small amount of information on copyright. Many of the scores are for music composed or arranged by Hosmer. Other composers represented in the collection are Debussy, Ravel, Hamm, Kuhlau, Hohler, Reinecke, and Silvius.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
